intro: Bradburya dasyantha, commonly known as the desert bell, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces a cluster of bulbous stems that store water. Bradburya dasyantha is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, where it thrives with minimal water and full sun exposure.
